name: CSA CCM v4
description: The Cloud Security Alliance Cloud Controls Matrix (CCM) is a cybersecurity control framework for cloud computing. It is composed of 197 control objectives structured in 17 domains covering all key aspects of cloud technology.

requirements.title: Audit & Assurance
requirements.description: Establish audit planning, implement independent assessments, and manage risk-based planning.

children.title: Audit and Assurance Policy and Procedures
children.description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate, and maintain audit and assurance policies and procedures and standards.

children.title: Independent Assessments
children.description: Conduct independent audit and assurance assessments according to relevant standards at least annually.

children.title: Risk Based Planning Assessment
children.description: Perform independent audit and assurance assessments according to risk-based plans and policies.

children.title: Requirements Compliance
children.description: Verify compliance with all relevant standards, regulations, legal/contractual, and statutory requirements applicable to the audit.

children.title: Audit Management Process
children.description: Define and implement an audit management process to support audit planning, risk analysis, security control assessment, and conclusions.

children.title: Remediation
children.description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate, and maintain a remediation process for audit findings.

requirements.title: Application & Interface Security
requirements.description: Secure applications through development life cycle, application security testing, and API security.

children.title: Application and Interface Security Policy and Procedures
children.description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate, and maintain policies and procedures for application security.

children.title: Application Security Baseline Requirements
children.description: Establish, document, and maintain baseline requirements for securing different applications.

children.title: Application Security Metrics
children.description: Define and implement technical and operational metrics in alignment with business objectives and security requirements.

children.title: Secure Application Design and Development
children.description: Define and implement a Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) process for application design, development, deployment, and operation.

children.title: Automated Application Security Testing
children.description: Implement automated application security testing (e.g., SAST, DAST, IAST) as part of the SDLC.

children.title: Automated Secure Application Deployment
children.description: Implement automated deployment pipelines with security controls and configuration validation.

children.title: Application Vulnerability Remediation
children.description: Establish and implement a process for correcting application vulnerabilities discovered during assessments.

requirements.title: Business Continuity Management & Operational Resilience
requirements.description: Maintain business continuity through planning, testing, and redundancy.

children.title: Business Continuity Management Policy and Procedures
children.description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate, and maintain business continuity management policies and procedures.

children.title: Risk Assessment and Impact Analysis
children.description: Determine the impact of business disruptions and risks on operations through business impact analysis.

children.title: Business Continuity Strategy
children.description: Establish and implement strategies that reduce the impact of, withstand, and recover from business disruptions.

children.title: Business Continuity Planning
children.description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate, and maintain business continuity plans.

children.title: Documentation
children.description: Develop and maintain documentation that provides continuity of operations.

children.title: Business Continuity Exercises
children.description: Exercise and test business continuity and operational resilience plans at least annually.

children.title: Communication
children.description: Establish communication with relevant parties during business disruptions.

children.title: Backup
children.description: Establish and maintain a backup strategy appropriate for business objectives and continuity requirements.

children.title: Disaster Response Plan
children.description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate, and maintain a disaster response plan.

children.title: Response Plan Exercises
children.description: Exercise the response plan annually or upon significant organizational or environmental changes.

children.title: Equipment Redundancy
children.description: Implement physical and environmental protection with redundancy for all critical equipment.

requirements.title: Change Control & Configuration Management
requirements.description: Manage changes to systems and configurations through controlled processes.

children.title: Change Management Policy and Procedures
children.description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate, and maintain policies and procedures for managing changes.

children.title: Quality Testing
children.description: Perform functionality and resilience testing to verify quality prior to production deployment.

children.title: Change Management Technology
children.description: Implement a change management technology solution supporting change logging, tracking, and approval.

children.title: Unauthorized Change Protection
children.description: Implement mechanisms to detect and prevent unauthorized changes to systems.

children.title: Change Agreements
children.description: Include change management clauses and responsibilities in agreements with third-party cloud service providers.

children.title: Change Management Baseline
children.description: Establish a baseline for the management of change to production resources.

children.title: Detection of Baseline Deviation
children.description: Implement detection measures to identify configuration deviations from established baselines.

children.title: Exception Management
children.description: Define and implement a process for managing exceptions to the change management baseline.

children.title: Change Restoration
children.description: Define and implement a process for restoring the operational environment to the original state.

requirements.title: Cryptography, Encryption & Key Management
requirements.description: Implement cryptographic controls and key management processes.

children.title: Encryption and Key Management Policy and Procedures
children.description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate, and maintain policies and procedures for cryptography and key management.

children.title: CEK Roles and Responsibilities
children.description: Define and implement cryptographic and key management roles and responsibilities.

children.title: Data Encryption
children.description: Provide cryptographic protection to data at rest and in transit.

children.title: Encryption Algorithm
children.description: Use encryption algorithms that are appropriate for data protection using standards-based approaches.

children.title: Encryption Change Management
children.description: Manage changes to cryptographic systems and key management in accordance with change management policies.

children.title: Encryption Risk Management
children.description: Manage encryption and key management risk aligned with the enterprise risk management framework.

children.title: Key Generation
children.description: Generate cryptographic keys using approved methods and secure key generation mechanisms.

children.title: Key Rotation
children.description: Rotate cryptographic keys according to established cryptoperiod policies and key management standards.

children.title: Key Revocation
children.description: Define and implement mechanisms to revoke and remove cryptographic keys prior to cryptoperiod expiration.

children.title: Key Destruction
children.description: Destroy cryptographic keys at the end of cryptoperiod using secure destruction mechanisms.

children.title: Key Archival
children.description: Archive cryptographic keys securely with restricted access for potential future recovery.

children.title: Key Recovery
children.description: Define and implement cryptographic key recovery mechanisms to restore lost or corrupted keys.

children.title: Key Inventory Management
children.description: Define and implement policies for cryptographic key inventory including ownership, location, and key usage.

children.title: Key Compromise
children.description: Define and implement processes to address cryptographic key compromise.

children.title: Key Management Auditing
children.description: Audit key management operations and enable logging to trace key lifecycle.

children.title: Encryption Key Custody
children.description: Define and implement requirements for customers to independently manage their encryption keys.

requirements.title: Datacenter Security
requirements.description: Protect physical data center facilities and assets.

children.title: Off-Site Equipment Policy and Procedures
children.description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate, and maintain policies for off-site equipment security.

children.title: Off-Site Equipment
children.description: Establish and implement security controls for off-site equipment.

children.title: Off-Site Authorization
children.description: Authorize off-site transfer or use of data or assets only when business-justified.

children.title: Secure Area Policy and Procedures
children.description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate, and maintain policies for securing physical areas.

children.title: Secure Area Authorization
children.description: Restrict ingress and egress to secure areas to authorized personnel only.

children.title: Secure Area Surveillance
children.description: Monitor and audit secure areas using surveillance systems.

children.title: Secure Area Access Logs
children.description: Maintain access logs for secure areas including authorized and unauthorized access attempts.

children.title: Equipment Identification
children.description: Physically label and inventory computing equipment and devices within secure areas.

children.title: Secure Area Utility Services
children.description: Protect utility services (e.g., power, HVAC) that support secure areas from interruption.

children.title: Secure Disposal of Equipment
children.description: Establish and implement procedures for the secure disposal of equipment.

requirements.title: Data Security & Privacy Lifecycle Management
requirements.description: Manage data security and privacy throughout the data lifecycle.

children.title: Data Security and Privacy Policy and Procedures
children.description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate, and maintain data security and privacy policies.

children.title: Secure Disposal
children.description: Establish and implement a process for secure disposal of data in all phases and media.

children.title: Data Inventory
children.description: Create and maintain a data inventory with data classifications, identification of applicable regulations, and data privacy requirements.

children.title: Data Classification
children.description: Classify data according to type, sensitivity, and criticality and apply appropriate protective controls.

children.title: Data Flow Documentation
children.description: Create and maintain data flow documentation showing how data transits systems and networks.

children.title: Data Ownership and Stewardship
children.description: Assign data owners and stewards with defined responsibilities.

children.title: Data Protection by Design and Default
children.description: Integrate data protection by design and by default into system development lifecycles.

children.title: Data Privacy by Design and Default
children.description: Integrate privacy by design principles in system development and processing activities.

children.title: Data Privacy Impact Assessment
children.description: Conduct and document data privacy impact assessments for processing activities involving personal data.

children.title: Sensitive Data Transfer
children.description: Define and implement technical, organizational, and contractual measures for transfers of sensitive data.

children.title: Personal Data Access, Rectification, and Erasure
children.description: Implement mechanisms for data subjects to access, rectify, or request erasure of personal data.

children.title: Limitation of Personal Data Processing
children.description: Limit processing of personal data to that necessary for the stated purpose.

children.title: Personal Data Sub-processing
children.description: Define and implement security measures for sub-processors of personal data.

children.title: Disclosure of Data Sub-processors
children.description: Disclose the use of third-party sub-processors to data subjects as required by applicable regulations.

children.title: Limitation of Purpose
children.description: Limit personal data processing to the purposes identified prior to collection and not process for incompatible purposes.

children.title: Retention and Disposal
children.description: Define and implement data retention and disposal policies aligned with regulatory and business requirements.

children.title: Sensitive Data Protection
children.description: Implement additional protections for sensitive data as required by applicable regulations.

children.title: Disclosure Notifications
children.description: Notify data subjects and relevant authorities of data disclosures as required by law.

children.title: Data Location
children.description: Define and implement policies that identify geographic locations where data is stored and processed.

requirements.title: Governance, Risk & Compliance
requirements.description: Establish governance structures, manage risk, and ensure compliance.

children.title: Governance Program Policy and Procedures
children.description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate, and maintain governance policies and procedures.

children.title: Risk Management Program
children.description: Establish and maintain an enterprise risk management program aligned with business objectives.

children.title: Organizational Policy Reviews
children.description: Review all organizational policies at planned intervals or upon significant changes.

children.title: Policy Exception Process
children.description: Establish and implement a policy exception process with documented risk acceptance.

children.title: Information Security Program
children.description: Develop and implement an information security program that includes security assessment, awareness, and risk management.

children.title: Governance Responsibility Model
children.description: Define and implement a responsibility model that identifies roles and responsibilities.

children.title: Information System Regulatory Mapping
children.description: Identify and document overlaps and gaps between organizational security and regulatory requirements.

children.title: Special Interest Groups
children.description: Maintain contact and membership with relevant special interest groups and professional associations.

requirements.title: Human Resources
requirements.description: Manage human resources security throughout employment lifecycle.

children.title: Background Verification Policy and Procedures
children.description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate, and maintain policies for background verification.

children.title: Background Verification
children.description: Conduct background verification checks on all personnel in accordance with policies and regulations.

children.title: Employment Agreements
children.description: Require personnel to sign employment agreements that include security and confidentiality obligations.

children.title: Employment Termination
children.description: Establish and implement policies for employment termination including access revocation.

children.title: Employment Termination Checklist
children.description: Follow a termination checklist for all personnel separating from the organization.

children.title: Security Awareness Training
children.description: Provide security awareness training to all personnel upon hire and periodically thereafter.

children.title: Roles and Responsibilities Awareness
children.description: Communicate and ensure personnel understand their security roles and responsibilities.

children.title: Training Records
children.description: Document and retain security awareness training records.

children.title: Personal and Sensitive Data Awareness
children.description: Provide training on handling personal and sensitive data to personnel who process such data.

children.title: Non-Disclosure Agreements
children.description: Require non-disclosure agreements from personnel with access to confidential data.

children.title: Mobile Device Management Policy and Procedures
children.description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate, and maintain mobile device management policies.

children.title: Acceptable Use Policy
children.description: Establish and implement acceptable use policies for organization-issued and personal devices.

children.title: Clean Desk Policy
children.description: Establish and implement a clean desk and clear screen policy.

requirements.title: Identity & Access Management
requirements.description: Manage identities and access to resources through authentication and authorization.

children.title: Identity and Access Management Policy and Procedures
children.description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate, and maintain identity and access management policies.

children.title: Strong Authentication
children.description: Implement multi-factor authentication for access to systems, applications, and data.

children.title: Identity Inventory
children.description: Manage an inventory of all identities used to access organizational systems and applications.

children.title: Separation of Duties
children.description: Implement separation of duties to prevent unauthorized actions.

children.title: Least Privilege
children.description: Employ the principle of least privilege for granting user access.

children.title: User Access Provisioning
children.description: Define and implement a user access provisioning process for granting system access.

children.title: User Access De-Provisioning
children.description: Define and implement a user access de-provisioning process for removing access.

children.title: User Access Reviews
children.description: Conduct periodic user access reviews to validate access privileges.

children.title: Segregation of Privileged Access Roles
children.description: Segregate privileged access roles from non-privileged access roles.

children.title: Privileged Access Management
children.description: Implement privileged access management for administrative access.

children.title: Federated Identity Management
children.description: Define and implement federated identity management for secure cross-organizational access.

children.title: User ID Credentials
children.description: Define and implement user ID credential standards for authentication.

children.title: Third Party Access
children.description: Manage third party access to organizational systems and data.

children.title: System Access Revocation
children.description: Establish and implement timeframes for revoking access when no longer required.

children.title: System Trust Verification
children.description: Verify identities and trust relationships between systems before allowing connections.

children.title: Authentication Mechanism Protection
children.description: Protect authentication mechanisms from unauthorized access and manipulation.

requirements.title: Interoperability & Portability
requirements.description: Ensure interoperability and data portability across cloud environments.

children.title: Interoperability and Portability Policy and Procedures
children.description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate, and maintain policies for interoperability and portability.

children.title: Secure Interoperability and Portability Management
children.description: Implement solutions for secure interoperability and portability between cloud environments.

children.title: Data Portability
children.description: Provide mechanisms for data portability to allow secure data transfer.

children.title: Application Portability
children.description: Provide mechanisms for application portability between cloud environments.

children.title: Infrastructure and Virtualization Security Policy and Procedures
children.description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate, and maintain policies for infrastructure security.

children.title: Capacity and Resource Planning
children.description: Plan and monitor the capacity and use of infrastructure resources.

children.title: Network Security
children.description: Implement network security controls including segmentation, filtering, and monitoring.

children.title: OS Hardening and Base Controls
children.description: Harden operating systems and establish base security controls.

children.title: Production and Non-Production Environments
children.description: Separate production and non-production environments.

children.title: Segmentation and Segregation
children.description: Implement logical and physical segmentation controls.

children.title: Migration to Cloud Environments
children.description: Establish and implement migration security controls when moving to cloud environments.

children.title: Network Architecture Documentation
children.description: Document network architecture including security controls.

children.title: Network Defense
children.description: Implement defense-in-depth network security controls.

requirements.title: Logging and Monitoring
requirements.description: Implement logging, monitoring, and security event management.

children.title: Logging and Monitoring Policy and Procedures
children.description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate, and maintain logging and monitoring policies.

children.title: Security Log Management
children.description: Implement security log management including collection, analysis, and retention.

children.title: Security Monitoring and Alerting
children.description: Implement security monitoring and alerting to detect security events.

children.title: Audit Logs Protection
children.description: Protect audit logs from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.

children.title: Audit Log Retention
children.description: Retain audit logs according to organizational and regulatory requirements.

children.title: Clock Synchronization
children.description: Synchronize system clocks to a consistent and accurate time source.

children.title: Logging and Monitoring Access
children.description: Restrict access to logging and monitoring systems to authorized personnel.

children.title: Monitoring System Access
children.description: Monitor access to audit logging and monitoring systems.

children.title: Log Failure Alerts
children.description: Implement alerts for logging failures to ensure continuous audit trail.

children.title: Transaction/Activity Logs
children.description: Log transaction and activity data for security monitoring.

children.title: Encryption Monitoring and Reporting
children.description: Monitor and report on the use of encryption technologies.

children.title: Access Control Logs
children.description: Log access control events including authentication and authorization activities.

children.title: Failures and Anomalies Reporting
children.description: Report security failures and anomalies to appropriate personnel.

requirements.title: Security Incident Management, E-Discovery & Cloud Forensics
requirements.description: Manage security incidents and support forensic investigations.

children.title: Security Incident Management Policy and Procedures
children.description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate, and maintain security incident management policies.

children.title: Service Management Policy and Procedures
children.description: Establish policies for incident reporting and response coordination.

children.title: Incident Response Plans
children.description: Develop and maintain incident response plans that define roles, responsibilities, and procedures.

children.title: Incident Response Testing
children.description: Test incident response plans and procedures periodically.

children.title: Incident Response Metrics
children.description: Define and track incident response metrics.

children.title: Event Triage Processes
children.description: Implement event triage processes to identify and prioritize security events.

children.title: Security Breach Notification
children.description: Implement procedures for notifying affected parties of security breaches.

children.title: Points of Contact Maintenance
children.description: Maintain points of contact for security incident reporting and notification.

requirements.title: Supply Chain Management, Transparency & Accountability
requirements.description: Manage supply chain security and third-party relationships.

children.title: SSRM Policy and Procedures
children.description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate, and maintain supply chain policies.

children.title: SSRM Supply Chain
children.description: Establish and implement supply chain security controls.

children.title: SSRM Guidance
children.description: Provide guidance on shared security responsibility model to customers.

children.title: SSRM Control Ownership
children.description: Document and communicate ownership of security controls.

children.title: SSRM Documentation Review
children.description: Review shared security responsibility documentation periodically.

children.title: SSRM Control Baseline
children.description: Establish a baseline of security controls that customers can expect.

children.title: Supply Chain Inventory
children.description: Maintain an inventory of supply chain relationships and dependencies.

children.title: Supply Chain Risk Management
children.description: Implement supply chain risk management processes.

children.title: Primary Service and Contractual Agreement
children.description: Define and document primary service obligations and contractual agreements.

children.title: Supply Chain Agreement Review
children.description: Review and assess supply chain agreements periodically.

children.title: Internal Compliance Testing
children.description: Conduct internal compliance testing of supply chain security controls.

children.title: Supply Chain Service Agreement Compliance
children.description: Monitor and ensure compliance with supply chain service agreements.

children.title: Supply Chain Governance Review
children.description: Conduct periodic reviews of supply chain governance.

children.title: Supply Chain Data Security Assessment
children.description: Assess data security controls of supply chain partners.

requirements.title: Threat & Vulnerability Management
requirements.description: Identify, assess, and remediate threats and vulnerabilities.

children.title: Threat and Vulnerability Management Policy and Procedures
children.description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate, and maintain threat and vulnerability management policies.

children.title: Malware Protection Policy and Procedures
children.description: Establish policies and procedures for malware protection.

children.title: Vulnerability Remediation Schedule
children.description: Establish schedules for vulnerability remediation based on risk.

children.title: Detection Updates
children.description: Update threat detection mechanisms regularly.

children.title: External Library Vulnerabilities
children.description: Identify and remediate vulnerabilities in external libraries and components.

children.title: Penetration Testing
children.description: Conduct penetration testing according to risk-based planning.

children.title: Vulnerability Identification
children.description: Identify vulnerabilities through scanning and assessment.

children.title: Vulnerability Prioritization
children.description: Prioritize vulnerabilities based on risk and business impact.

children.title: Vulnerability Management Reporting
children.description: Report on vulnerability management activities and status.

children.title: Vulnerability Remediation Exception Management
children.description: Manage exceptions to vulnerability remediation requirements.

children.title: Endpoint Devices Policy and Procedures
children.description: Establish, document, approve, communicate, apply, evaluate, and maintain endpoint management policies.

children.title: Application and Service Approval
children.description: Approve applications and services for use on endpoint devices.

children.title: Compatibility
children.description: Ensure compatibility of applications and services on managed endpoints.

children.title: Endpoint Inventory
children.description: Maintain an inventory of all endpoint devices.

children.title: Endpoint Management
children.description: Implement endpoint management solutions for configuration and control.

children.title: Automatic Lock Screen
children.description: Implement automatic lock screens on endpoint devices.

children.title: Operating Systems
children.description: Ensure endpoint operating systems are current and supported.

children.title: Storage Encryption
children.description: Encrypt data at rest on endpoint devices.

children.title: Anti-Malware Detection and Prevention
children.description: Implement anti-malware solutions on endpoint devices.

children.title: Software Firewall
children.description: Implement host-based firewalls on endpoint devices.

children.title: Data Loss Prevention
children.description: Implement data loss prevention controls on endpoints.

children.title: Remote Locate
children.description: Implement capability to remotely locate lost or stolen devices.

children.title: Remote Wipe
children.description: Implement capability to remotely wipe lost or stolen devices.

children.title: Third-Party Endpoint Security Posture
children.description: Assess and monitor third-party endpoint security posture.
